subject: Simsonn VAM pro haptic issue
description_text:
Hi,

I purchased the Simsonn pro X ultras as well as a VAM pro linear haptic for the brake pedal. I am receiving an issue with intermittent feedback or sometimes continued feedback with no input. I have tired both the simsoon software as well as simhub. I’ve added the nylon washers between the pedal and haptic. I’m not sure what else to do. I did have an issue with the haptics not showing power initially even though they were plugged in properly. I figured it could be an issue with the control box?  Eventually after unplugging and plugging in the pedals a couple times they seemed to work.

conversations.body_text: Hi Michael Allen,  If this happens, it indicates that the computer’s grounding is not reliable, possibly because a three-prong plug was not used with a three-prong wall outlet. You can refer to the post below: connect the computer case to the stand, and connect the control box to the metal screws on the pedals. This should resolve the disconnection issue.  https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding

Hi,

I changed my power strip to use a three pronged connector for the computer. This did not help, when racing this time the VAM PRO totally lost connection and kept shaking until I unplugged the power supply from the control box. My contol box seems to have a somewhat loose connection for the power supply input, could the control box be the issue? 

Thanks,

>

Hi Michael Allen,   Could you please take a photo of the grounding connections for me to check? I’d like to see the wiring between the PC case, the control box, and the pedals. If all three are connected securely, signal interruptions should not occur. Additionally, please try securing the VAM Pro power cable with cable ties and see if that helps.

You can see here I connected from pedal to control box and from control box to PC chassis mount for power supply which should have sufficient ground. The performance has not changed at all. 

I sanded down all connection surfaces to make sure it had a good connection too. 



>

Hello? I haven’t received a response. I think there is an issue with my haptic power supply or the control box. I turned off my bass shakers and my direct drive base while testing and still had the same issue. 

The first 4-5 tests of the haptic work fine and then after that on the 5th test I get a very long shake from the haptic as if it lost connection. The same happens in games while playing. 

>
